member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Builder.BindingParameterConfiguration
member.summary:
Represents a BindingParameter.
Actions/Functions can have at most one BindingParameter. This parameter has similar semantics to the 'this' keyword in C# extensions methods.
For example given a url that identifies a Movie, if there is an action that has a bindingParameter that is a Movie, you can bind the Action to the url.
i.e. if ~/Movies(1) identifies a Movie, and there exists a Checkout action that has a Movie BindingParameter, you can invoke that Action at this url ~/Movies(1)/Checkout
The BindingParameter type must either be an EntityType or a Collection of EntityTypes.

member.summary: to figure out if a structural type is abstract or not. This convention configures all structural types backed by an abstract CLR type as abstract.

member.summary: The ActionLinkGenerationConvention calls action.HasActionLink(..) if the action binds to a single entity and has not previously been configured.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Builder.Conventions.AssociationSetDiscoveryConvention
member.summary: to configure the EDM association sets for the given entity set. This convention adds an association set for each EDM navigation property defined in this type, its base types and all its derived types. The target navigation source chosen is the default navigation source for the navigation property's target entity type. The default navigation source for an entity type is the navigation source that contains entity of that entity type. If more than one navigation source match, the default navigation source is none. If no navigation sources match the default navigation source is the default navigation source of the base type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Builder.LowerCamelCaser
member.summary: Default lower camel caser to resolve property names for . The rule is to convert the leading upper case characters to lower case, until a character, which is not the first character and is followed by a non-upper case character, is met. id => id, ID => id, MyName => myName, IOStream => ioStream, MyID => myid, yourID => yourID

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Builder.NonbindingParameterConfiguration
member.summary:
Represents a non-binding operation parameter.
Non binding parameters are provided in the POST body for Actions Non binding parameters are provided in 3 ways for Functions - ~/.../Function(p1=value) - ~/.../Function(p1=@x)?@x=value - ~/.../Function?p1=value (only allowed if the Function is the last url path segment).

member.summary:
Attempts to set the Property called to the specified.
Only properties that exist on Entity can be set. If there is a type mismatch the request will fail.
member.param: The name of the Property
The new value of the Property
member.returns: True if successful

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Delta.TryGetPropertyValue(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary:
Attempts to get the value of the Property called from the underlying Entity.
Only properties that exist on Entity can be retrieved. Both modified and unmodified properties can be retrieved.
member.param: The name of the Property
The value of the Property
member.returns: True if the Property was found

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Delta.TryGetPropertyType(System.String,System.Type@)

The type of the Property
member.returns: Returns true if the Property was found and false if not.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.Expressions.ModelContainer
member.summary: EntityFramework does not let you inject non primitive constant values (like IEdmModel) in Select queries. Primitives like strings and guids can be injected as they can be translated into a SQL query. This container associates a unique string with each EDM model, so that, given the string the model can be retrieved later.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.Expressions.NamedPropertyExpression
member.summary: Represents a container that captures a named property that is a part of the select expand query.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.Expressions.PropertyContainer
member.summary: A container of property names and property values.
member.remarks: EntityFramework understands only member initializations in Select expressions. Also, it doesn't understand type casts for non-primitive types. So, SelectExpandBinder has to generate strongly types expressions that involve only property access. This class represents the base class for a bunch of generic derived types that are used in the expressions that SelectExpandBinder generates.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.Expressions.UriFunctionsBinder
member.summary: This class helps to bind uri functions to CLR. For creating an Expression and apply it on a Queryable collection, we must get the CLR information, i.e MethodInfo of each EdmFunction which is mentioned in the EdmModel. If you add a custom uri function in OData.Core via 'CustomUriFunctions' class, you must bind it to it's MethodInfo.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.Expressions.UriFunctionsBinder.BindUriFunctionName(System.String,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Bind the given function name to the given MethodInfo. The binding helps to create an Expression out of the method. You can bind a static method, a static extension method, and an instance method. You should be carefull about binding instance methods - the declaring type of the method i.e the instance type, will be considered as the first argument of the function.
member.param: The uri function name that appears in the OData request uri.
The MethodInfo to bind the given function name.
member.exception: Function name argument is Null or empty
The given FunctionName is already binded to another MethodInfo.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.Expressions.UriFunctionsBinder.UnbindUriFunctionName(System.String,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Unbind the given function name from the given MethodInfo.
member.param: The uri function name to unbind.
The MethodInfo to unbind from the given function name.
member.exception: Function name argument is Null or empty
member.returns: 'True' if function has unbinded. 'False' otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.IPropertyMapper
member.summary: The result of a $select and $expand projection is represented as an instance. That instance can be projected into an instance by calling . That method will use the function to construct an that will map the property names in that projection to the keys in the returned . The main purpose of converting an instance into an (using the method mentioned above) is to allow changing the names of the properties in the that will be used during the serialization of the $select and $expand projection by a given formatter. For example, to support custom serialization attributes of a particular formatter.

member.returns: The value that will be used as the key for this property in the resulting from calling ToDictionary on an instance.

member.summary: Specifies a non-negative integer n that excludes the first n items of the queried collection from the result.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the $skip query option. The service returns items starting at position n+1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions.Top
member.summary: Specifies a non-negative integer n that limits the number of items returned from a collection.
member.remarks: Corresponds to the $take query option. he service returns the number of available items up to but not greater than the specified value n.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions.Count
member.summary: The $count system query option allows clients to request a count of the matching resources included with the resources in the response. The $count query option has a Boolean value of true or false.
member.remarks: The semantics of $count is covered in the [OData - Protocol] document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions.ApplyForCount(System.Linq.IQueryable,Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings)
member.summary: Applies the queries that are applicable to the $count computation, as per the OData protocol.
member.remarks:
According to the protocol:
The $count system query option ignores any $top, $skip, or $expand query options, and returns the total count of results across all pages including only those results matching any specified $filter and $search. Clients should be aware that the count returned inline may not exactly equal the actual number of items returned, due to latency between calculating the count and enumerating the last value or due to inexact calculations on the service.
member.param: The original .
The settings to use in query composition.
member.returns: The new after the query has been applied to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.EnsureStableOrdering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether query composition should alter the original query when necessary to ensure a stable sort order.
member.value: A true value indicates the original query should be modified when necessary to guarantee a stable sort order. A false value indicates the sort order can be considered stable without modifying the query. Query providers that ensure a stable sort order should set this value to false. The default value is true.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings
member.summary: This class describes the validation settings for querying.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedArithmeticOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed arithmetic operators including 'add', 'sub', 'mul', 'div', 'mod'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedFunctions
member.summary:
Gets or sets a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query.
The allowed functions include the following:
String related: substringof, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat
e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19
Date and Time related: year, month, day, hour, minute, second, fractionalseconds, date, time
e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971
Math related: round, floor, ceiling
Type related:isof, cast,
Collection related: any, all

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed logical operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedOrderByProperties
member.summary:
Gets a list of properties one can orderby the result with. Note, by default this list is empty, it means it can be ordered by any property.
For example, having an empty collection means client can order the queryable result by any properties. Adding "Name" to this list means that it only allows queryable result to be ordered by Name property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedQueryOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the query parameters that are allowed inside query. The default is all query options, including $filter, $skip, $top, $orderby, $expand, $select, $count, $format, $skiptoken and $deltatoken.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxOrderByNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of expressions that can be present in the $orderby.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxAnyAllExpressionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query.
member.remarks: The default value is 1.
member.value: The maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of the nodes inside the $filter syntax tree.
member.remarks: The default value is 100.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxSkip
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $skip that a client can request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $top that a client can request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxExpansionDepth

member.remarks: To disable the maximum expansion depth check, set this property to 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OData.Query.SelectExpandQueryOption.LevelsMaxLiteralExpansionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of levels that a top level $expand=NavigationProperty($levels=max) will be expanded. This value will decrease by one with each nesting level in the $expand clause. For example, with a property value 5, the following query $expand=A($expand=B($expand=C($levels=max))) will be interpreted as $expand=A($expand=B($expand=C($levels=3))). If the query gets validated, the value must be greater than or equal to this value.
